sentences.sentence: The Old Woman and Her Servants
A woman had two servants whom she used to call to work as soon as she heard the rooster( 公鸡 ) cry in the morning.
The servants hated getting up so early in the morning and decided to kill the rooster( 公鸡 ), since it was his cry that meant they had to start work.
But with the rooster( 公鸡 ) dead, the woman did not know what time it was, and often woke the servants even in the middle of the night.
MORAL: Those who try too hard to be clever often create bigger problems for themselves.
The One-Eyed Deer( 鹿 )
A deer( 鹿 ), who could only see out of one eye, used to eat as near to the sea as she possibly could, to be safe.
She turned her good eye towards the land, so she could see any danger coming,
and she turned her bad eye towards the sea, as she thought there was no danger.
Some boatmen, sailing( 航行 ) by, saw her and shot her.
She said before dying, “I was wrong to be worried about danger from the land.
After all, this beach which I came to for safety is much more dangerous.”
MORAL: Danger sometimes comes from a place we don’t expect.
The Peacock( 孔雀 ) and the Swallow( 燕子 )
The peacock( 孔雀 ) kept waving( 挥舞 ) his beautiful, brightly-colored feathers( 羽毛 ) back and forth( 反复地 ),
while he argued with the small, brown-winged swallow( 燕子 ) about which one of them was the best.
The swallow( 燕子 ) finally replied, “You may make fun of( 取笑 ) the color of my wings, but I am small and light, and can rise on these wings high up into the sky.
You, on the other hand, can only flap( 拍打 ) those beautiful feathers( 羽毛 ) of yours down there on the ground, just like a chicken.
Those fine feathers( 羽毛 ) you are so proud of only weigh you down!”
MORAL: We travel furthest and highest when we let go of our pride.
The Peacock( 孔雀 ) Elected( 竞选 ) King of the Birds
All the birds met together to choose a king for themselves.
The peacock( 孔雀 ) said to the other birds,
“I should be king, because I am by far the best-looking and handsomest of all the birds.”
The other birds all agreed. However, the wise raven( 渡鸦 ) stepped forward among them and said to the peacock( 孔雀 ),
“You are indeed a very beautiful bird.
But please tell me—if you become king, what will you do when the eagle( 鹰 ) attacks us?
You may be good-looking, but are you strong enough to protect us from( 保护...免受... ) his strength, speed, and cruelty( 残暴 )?”
MORAL: Don’t choose your rulers for their attractiveness( 吸引力 ).
The Pig and the Sheep
A pig found his way into a field where a group of sheep were eating grass.
The farmer caught him, and was carrying him off to the butcher( 屠夫 )’s when the pig made a loud noise and tried to get free.
The sheep, annoyed( 被激怒 ) by this, said to him, “The farmer often catches us and takes us away just like that, and we don’t say anything.”
“No, I’m sure you don’t,” replied the pig;
“but our situations are different.
He only wants you for wool( 羊毛 ), but he wants me for food.”
MORAL: We have great powers that come to us only in an emergency( 紧急情况 ).

question.cn: 在故事The Old Woman and Her Servants中，公鸡死后发生了什么？
question.en: In the story the Old Woman and Her Servants, what happened after the rooster's death?

options.en: The servants could sleep as long as they want.
The servants were often woken in the middle of the night.

analysis: 文中提到：“But with the rooster dead, the woman did not know what time it was, and often woke the servants even in the middle of the night.”公鸡死了之后，女主人不知道确切时间，经常在半夜就把仆人叫醒干活，因此选C。

question.cn: 在故事The One-Eyed Deer中，谁杀死了鹿？
question.en: In the story the One-Eyed Deer, who killed the deer?

analysis: 文中提到：“Some boatmen, sailing by, saw her and shot her.”可知，一些路过的船夫开枪打死了她，因此选A。

question.cn: 在故事The Peacock and the Swallow中，为什么孔雀飞不高？
question.en: In the story the Peacock and the Swallow, why couldn't the peacock fly high?

options.en: His beautiful feathers were too heavy.

analysis:
文中提到：“Those fine feathers your are so proud of only weigh you down.”
孔雀的羽毛太重了，飞不高，因此选A。

question.cn: 在故事The Peacock Elected King of the Birds中，为什么渡鸦拒绝选举孔雀作为鸟类的王？
question.en: In the story the Peacock Elected King of the Birds, why did the raven refuse to elect the peacock as their king？

analysis: 文中提到：“If you become king, what will you do when the eagle attacks us？ You may be good-looking, but are you strong enough to protect us from his strength, speed and cruelty.”可知，渡鸦不同意的原因是孔雀没有保护他们的能力，因此选B。

question.cn: 在故事The Pig and the Sheep中，为什么农夫把猪抓起来？
question.en: In the story the Pig and the Sheep, why did the farmer catch the pig?

analysis: 文中提到：“He only wants you for wool, but he wanted me for food.”可知，农夫抓猪的目的是为了猪肉，因此选B。
